types.terminal_cell_t: fields: ch uint32_t, attributes uint8_t, fg_color uint8_t, bg_color uint8_t
types.screen_buffer_t: fields: cells array, width int, height int, cursor_x int, cursor_y int, scroll_offset int, scrollback array, scrollback_lines int
types.pty_session_t: fields: master_fd int, slave_fd int, child_pid pid_t, process_running bool, exit_status int
types.terminal_state_t: fields: original_termios struct, raw_mode_active bool, restoration_registered bool
types.pane_t: fields: id int, session pty_session_t, buffer screen_buffer_t, x int, y int, width int, height int
types.layout_node_t: fields: type layout_type_t, pane_id int, split_ratio float, left pointer, right pointer
types.escape_parser_t: fields: state parser_state_t, esc_buffer char array, esc_buffer_len int
types.parser_state_t: enum: NORMAL, ESCAPE, CSI_PARAMS, OSC_PARAMS, UTF8_CONTINUE
types.window_manager_t: fields: panes array, pane_count int, active_pane_id int, layout_root pointer
types.input_handler_t: fields: terminal_state terminal_state_t, prefix_state prefix_state_t, window_manager pointer
types.input_event_t: fields: type input_event_type_t, codepoint uint32_t, special_key int, modifiers int, command char array
types.key_binding_t: fields: key char, modifiers int, command char array, description char array
types.event_loop_t: fields: read_fds fd_set, max_fd int, pane_fd_map array, fd_pane_map array, window_manager window_manager_t*, input_handler input_handler_t*, shutdown_requested bool
types.fd_set: system type for select() file descriptor sets
types.test_results_t: fields: tests_run int, tests_passed int, tests_failed int, last_failure char array
types.log_level_t: enum: LOG_ERROR, LOG_WARN, LOG_INFO, LOG_DEBUG, LOG_TRACE
types.session_registry_entry_t: fields: session_id char array, session_name char array, creation_time time_t, last_attach_time time_t, process_count int, working_directory char array, state_file_path char array, is_attached bool
types.session_registry_t: fields: entries array, entry_count int, capacity int, registry_path char array
types.copy_mode_state_t: fields: cursor_x int, cursor_y int, selection_start_x int, selection_start_y int, selection_end_x int, selection_end_y int, selection_active bool, line_selection_mode bool, search_pattern char*, search_matches int*, search_match_count int, current_match_index int
types.status_segment_type_t: enum: SEGMENT_SESSION_INFO, SEGMENT_PANE_STATUS, SEGMENT_PROCESS_STATUS, SEGMENT_SYSTEM_METRICS, SEGMENT_TIME_DISPLAY, SEGMENT_CUSTOM_COMMAND
types.status_segment_t: fields: type status_segment_type_t, content char array, width int, needs_update bool, last_update time_t, update_interval int, command char array, next pointer
types.status_bar_t: fields: segments pointer, rendered_bar char array, terminal_width int, needs_full_render bool

methods.terminal_enter_raw_mode(state): enter raw terminal mode saving original state
methods.pty_session_create(session, shell_comman: creates new PTY session with shell process
methods.pty_session_is_alive(session): checks if child process still running
methods.screen_buffer_clear(buffer, mode): clear screen based on mode parameter
methods.escape_parser_process_byte(parser, buffe: process single input byte through parser
methods.utf8_is_wide_character(codepoint): check if character needs double width
methods.layout_create_root_pane(pane_id): creates root layout node for first pane
methods.layout_find_pane_node(root, pane_id): locates layout node containing specified pane
methods.layout_split_pane(root, pane_id, split_t: transforms pane into split with new child
methods.window_manager_init(wm, width, height): initializes window manager with terminal dimensions
methods.window_manager_create_pane(wm, shell_com: creates new pane with PTY session
methods.window_manager_split_pane(wm, pane_id, s: splits existing pane creating new adjacent pane
methods.window_manager_close_pane(wm, pane_id): removes pane and updates layout tree
methods.window_manager_render_frame(wm): composites all panes into terminal output
methods.terminal_enter_raw_mode(state) returns i: enter raw terminal mode saving original state
methods.terminal_register_cleanup(state) returns: register cleanup handlers for safe restoration
methods.input_handler_init(handler, wm) returns: initialize input handler with terminal mode setup
methods.input_handler_process_input(handler, eve: process input from stdin returns number of events
methods.input_handler_handle_prefix_key(handler): handle prefix key detection and command mode
methods.input_handler_route_event(handler, event: route input event to appropriate destination
methods.event_loop_init(loop, wm, input) returns: initialize event loop with component references
methods.event_loop_run(loop) returns int: main event processing loop until shutdown
methods.event_loop_add_pane(loop, pane_id, pty_f: add PTY file descriptor to monitoring
methods.signal_utils_setup_handlers() returns in: install signal handlers for SIGWINCH and SIGCHLD
methods.fd_utils_is_ready(fds, fd) returns bool: check if fd is ready in set
methods.pty_handle_child_termination(wm): handle child process termination detected via SIGCHLD
methods.pty_handle_io_error(session, error_code): handle broken pipe or I/O errors on PTY
methods.pty_session_create(session, shell_comman: creates new PTY session with shell process
methods.pty_session_is_alive(session) returns bo: checks if child process still running
methods.escape_parser_process_byte(parser, buffe: process single input byte through parser
methods.debug_init(log_file, level) returns int: initialize logging system with output file and level
methods.debug_log(level, component, fmt, ...) re: core logging function with timestamp and context
methods.debug_log_hex(level, component, label, d: binary data logging for PTY streams and escape sequences
methods.pty_debug_dump_session(session) returns: dump complete PTY session state for debugging
methods.pty_debug_monitor_io(session, timeout_ms: monitor PTY I/O with detailed logging
methods.utf8_is_wide_character(codepoint) return: check if character needs double width
methods.session_registry_init(registry, config_d: initialize session registry with persistent storage
methods.copy_mode_enter(pane, state) returns int: enter copy mode for specified pane
methods.copy_mode_handle_key(pane, state, event): process key input in copy mode
methods.status_bar_init(bar, terminal_width) ret: initialize status bar with default segments
methods.status_bar_update(bar, wm) returns int: update status bar content and render if needed
methods.status_bar_add_segment(bar, type, comman: add new segment to status bar
methods.status_bar_render(bar) returns int: render complete status bar to string

constants.FD_SETSIZE: system limit for select fd_set size
constants.SA_RESTART: signal flag to restart interrupted system calls
constants.SA_NOCLDSTOP: signal flag to ignore child stop events
constants.O_NONBLOCK: file descriptor flag for non-blocking I/O
constants.EINTR: error code for interrupted system call
constants.SA_NOCLDWAIT: signal flag to ignore child stop events
constants.SEGMENT_CUSTOM_COMMAND: status segment showing custom command output

terms.terminal multiplexer: system that manages multiple shell sessions through single terminal interface
terms.pseudo-terminal: PTY software device that emulates real terminal hardware
terms.session persistence: ability to detach and reattach to running shell sessions
terms.pane: rectangular screen region containing one shell session
terms.escape sequence: special character codes for terminal control like cursor movement and formatting
terms.raw terminal mode: terminal configuration that passes all input to application
terms.controlling terminal: terminal device associated with process session
terms.session leader: process that created new session and controls terminal access
terms.screen buffer: virtual representation of terminal display state with character grid
terms.scrollback buffer: storage for lines that scrolled off visible screen
terms.layout tree: binary tree structure representing pane split hierarchy
terms.terminal emulator: component that parses escape sequences and maintains virtual screen buffers
terms.UTF-8 decoder: component that handles multi-byte Unicode character sequences
terms.state machine: parser that transitions between states based on input characters
terms.terminal cell: individual character position with associated attributes and colors
terms.cursor position: current location where next character will be placed
terms.text attributes: formatting like bold, underline, and color applied to characters
terms.split ratio: proportion 0.0-1.0 determining space division between child panes
terms.window manager: component managing pane layout and screen composition
terms.border characters: visual separators drawn around pane boundaries
terms.screen composition: process of combining multiple pane buffers into unified display
terms.frame-based rendering: periodic generation of complete screen image
terms.focus highlighting: visual indication of currently active pane
terms.layout calculation: algorithm determining absolute pane coordinates from tree structure
terms.prefix key mechanism: escape sequence that signals transition to command mode
terms.command mode: temporary state where keystrokes are interpreted as multiplexer commands
terms.input event: structured representation of keyboard input with metadata
terms.terminal restoration: returning terminal to original configuration when multiplexer exits
terms.signal forwarding: sending signals to appropriate process groups in panes
terms.UTF-8 sequence assembly: buffering multi-byte Unicode characters until complete
terms.escape sequence detection: recognizing special key combinations that generate multi-byte sequences
terms.prefix state machine: state tracking system for command mode transitions
terms.input routing: directing keyboard events to either active pane or multiplexer
terms.terminal attributes: configuration settings that control terminal driver behavior
terms.process group management: ensuring signals reach appropriate shell processes and children
terms.event loop: main processing loop that coordinates I/O from multiple sources using select
terms.I/O multiplexing: technique for handling multiple file descriptors without blocking
terms.file descriptor set: data structure tracking which file descriptors to monitor for I/O readiness
terms.inter-component communication: structured data flow between terminal multiplexer components
terms.state synchronization: maintaining consistent shared state across multiple components
terms.focus management: system for tracking and coordinating which pane receives user input
terms.event flow coordination: ensuring related events process in correct order across components
terms.terminal size synchronization: coordinating terminal resize across layout, PTY sessions, and display
terms.process lifecycle coordination: managing child process events across PTY manager and window manager
terms.data transformation pipeline: sequence of components that transform raw PTY output into display updates
terms.canonical state authority: single component responsible for authoritative version of shared state
terms.eventual consistency: guarantee that all components eventually reflect same logical state
terms.signal-safe operations: functions safe to call from signal handlers
terms.select() system call: I/O multiplexing function that waits for multiple file descriptors
terms.file descriptor mapping: data structures that associate file descriptors with pane identifiers
terms.event processing pipeline: structured sequence for handling different types of system events
terms.atomic display updates: ensuring screen changes appear as single consistent update
terms.focus state: system state indicating which pane is currently active for input
terms.integration testing: end-to-end testing with real shell processes and terminal output verification
terms.component unit tests: testing individual components like escape sequence parser and layout calculator
terms.milestone verification checkpoints: specific tests and expected behaviors after completing each milestone
terms.copy mode: keyboard-driven text selection and clipboard integration mode
terms.status bar: persistent information display across terminal window
terms.session registry: tracking system for active detached sessions
terms.status segments: modular components of customizable status bar
terms.copy cursor: independent cursor for text selection navigation
terms.clipboard integration: synchronization between multiplexer and system clipboard
terms.process lifecycle management: handling child process state changes during detachment
terms.state serialization: converting multiplexer state to persistent storage format
terms.reattachment process: reconstructing multiplexer state from persistent storage
terms.multi-key sequences: complex key combinations for command input
terms.session state explosion: problem of serializing too much transient state
terms.differential rendering: updating only changed portions of display
terms.child process termination: event when shell process exits detected through SIGCHLD signals
terms.graceful degradation: continuing operation with reduced functionality when components fail
